cat23.Name: Neoplasm
cat23.Def: An organ or organ-system abnormality that consists of uncontrolled autonomous cell-proliferation which can occur in any part of the body as a benign or malignant neoplasm (tumour)

cat12.Name: Abnormality of the eye
cat12.Def: ny abnormality of the eye, including location, spacing, and intraocular abnormalities

cat14.Name: Abnormality of the immune system
cat14.Def: The immune system is composed of organs and interdependent cell types that collectively protect the body from infections and from the growth of tumor cells. The organs of the immune system comprise the bone marrow, the spleen, the thymus,the lymph nodes, and the cell types comprise B cells, T cells, natural killer cells, granulocytes,dendritic cells, and macrophages.

cat13.Name: Abnormality of the genitourinary system
cat13.Def: The presence of any abnormality of the genitourinary or urinary system.

cat9.Name: Abnormality of the cardiovascular system
cat9.Def: The cardiovascular system consists of the heart, vasculature, and the lymphatic system.

cat2.Name: Abnormality of connective tissue
cat2.Def: Any abnormality of the soft tissues, including both connective tissue (tendons, ligaments, fascia, fibrous tissues, and fat)

cat6.Name: Abnormality of prenatal development or birth
cat6.Def: An abnormality of the fetus or the birth of the fetus, excluding structural abnormalities.

cat7.Name: Abnormality of the abdomen
cat7.Def: A structural abnormality of the abdomen ('belly'), that is, the part of the body between the pelvis and the thorax.

cat11.Name: Abnormality of the endocrine system
cat11.Def: The endocrine system is composed of glands that secrete hormones directly into the bloodstream and includes the following glands: thyroid, parathyroids, adrenals, pancreas, gonads (testicles and ovaries), and pituitary. Many other organs, such as the kidney, liver, and heart, have secondary endocrine functions.

cat10.Name: Abnormality of the ear
cat10.Def: Either a morphological abnormality or hearing deficit

cat15.Name: Abnormality of the integument
cat15.Def: An abnormality of the integument, which consists of the skin and the superficial fascia.

cat1.Name: Abnormality of blood and blood-forming tissues
cat1.Def: Abnormality of organs that are involved in the production of blood, primarily the bone marrow, spleen, tonsils, and lymph nodes.

cat17.Name: Abnormality of the nervous system
cat17.Def: The nervous system comprises the neuraxis (brain, spinal cord, and ventricles), the autonomic nervous system, the enteric nervous system, and the peripheral nervous system.

cat16.Name: Abnormality of the musculature
cat16.Def: Abnormality originating in one or more muscles, i.e., of the set of muscles of body.

cat21.Name: Abnormality of the voice
cat21.Def: This term describes any abnormality of the voice, i.e., of the sounds produced by humans by the passage of air through the larynx and over the vocal cords, and then modified by the resonance organs, the nasopharynx, and the mouth.

cat18.Name: Abnormality of the respiratory system
cat18.Def: An abnormality of the respiratory system, which include the airways, lungs, and the respiratory muscles

cat3.Name: Abnormality of head or neck
cat3.Def: An abnormality of head and neck
